resources.name: Tarzana Treatment Centers
resources.description: Comprehensive behavioral healthcare organization providing substance abuse and mental health treatment for adults and youth since 1972. Operates psychiatric hospital, residential and outpatient treatment centers, and family medical clinics. Full continuum of services including medical detox, residential, outpatient rehabilitation, and psychiatric stabilization.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adults and youth with substance use disorders and/or mental health needs. Licensed and certified by State of California and LA County.
resources.fees: Accepts insurance and Medi-Cal - contact for details
accessibility_features: San Fernando Valley and Antelope Valley locations
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Tarzana Treatment Centers Los Angeles substance abuse mental health'

resources.name: Step Up on Second
resources.description: Pioneering permanent supportive housing facility providing 36 single-room occupancy units for adults experiencing serious mental health conditions and chronic homelessness. Founded in 1994 as Step Up's first development, offers comprehensive case management and recovery services with 98%+ 12-month retention rate.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adults experiencing serious mental health conditions and chronic homelessness. Uses Housing First model prioritizing permanent housing.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Step Up on Second Santa Monica mental health housing'

resources.name: SHIELDS for Families
resources.description: Community-based nonprofit providing comprehensive social services including child and youth development, child welfare, mental health services, substance abuse treatment, and supportive services such as food, transportation, housing assistance, legal services, and educational/vocational training.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals, children, and families in South Los Angeles seeking social services. Walk-ins welcome during business hours.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Shields for Families Los Angeles address phone services'

resources.name: Public Counsel
resources.description: Largest provider of pro bono legal services in the United States. Founded 1970, delivers free legal and social services to abused and abandoned children, homeless families and veterans, senior citizens, victims of consumer fraud, and nonprofits serving low-income communities. Handles veterans advocacy, appellate law, community development, early care law, homelessness prevention, children's rights, consumer law, immigrants' rights, and opportunity under law.
services_offered: Appellate law and federal pro se
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income individuals and families in Los Angeles County. Clients seen by appointment only. Call (213) 385-2977 or complete online intake form.
accessibility_features: Largest pro bono provider in US
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Public Counsel Los Angeles legal aid free services address'

resources.name: Bet Tzedek Legal Services
resources.description: Free legal services organization providing assistance to low-income individuals in Los Angeles County. Passionate staff and volunteers offer legal services, outreach, education, and policy advocacy. Handles elder law, employment rights, housing, public benefits, conservatorships, guardianships, Holocaust reparations, disability services, and more.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income individuals and families in Los Angeles County. Call (323) 939-0506, complete online intake, or access legal clinic. By appointment only.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Bet Tzedek Legal Services Los Angeles address phone free legal aid'

resources.name: Los Angeles Conservation Corps
resources.description: Youth development organization empowering young adults ages 18-25 with paid job training, education, and support services to build brighter futures. Provides conservation work, job skills training, educational opportunities, and career development in environmental and community service sectors.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Young adults ages 18-25 seeking job training and career development. Serves youth with barriers to employment.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'LA Conservation Corps employment training address phone'

resources.name: Weingart East Los Angeles YMCA
resources.description: Full-service YMCA facility providing fitness center, swimming pool, group exercise classes, youth programs, after-school care, and family support services. Offers comprehensive wellness programs including personal training, yoga, kickboxing, salsa, and child care services for East LA community.
services_offered: Fitness center with gym and equipment
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all East LA residents. Membership fees apply. Financial assistance available.
resources.fees: Membership fees apply, financial assistance available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Weingart East Los Angeles YMCA services address phone'

resources.name: Valley Community Healthcare - North Hollywood
resources.description: Community health center providing comprehensive healthcare services including medical care, mental health services, substance abuse treatment, HIV/AIDS services, and family planning. Serves approximately 21,000 men, women, children, teens, and seniors annually in San Fernando Valley.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Primarily serves people of all ages in San Fernando Valley. Accepts Medi-Cal and insurance. Sliding scale available.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal, insurance, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Valley Community Clinic San Fernando Valley healthcare address'

resources.name: Southern California Alcohol and Drug Programs (SCADP)
resources.description: Nonprofit substance abuse treatment provider established 1972, offering alternatives to incarceration for individuals with substance use disorders. Certified Drug Medi-Cal Provider offering outpatient, intensive outpatient, residential treatment, and recovery support services. Recognizes court-ordered programs including DUI, SUD, and PC1000.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with substance use disorders. Accepts Medi-Cal and My Health LA beneficiaries. Court-ordered clients accepted.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and My Health LA, Drug Medi-Cal certified
accessibility_features: La Casita for mothers with children
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Southern California Alcohol Drug Programs SCADP Los Angeles'

resources.name: All Peoples Community Center
resources.description: Community center empowering individuals in South Los Angeles through comprehensive services including monthly food distribution, case management, domestic violence support, licensed childcare and preschool, after-school programs, youth employment (ages 16-24), and adult job training and placement.
services_offered: Monthly food distribution with fresh produce
Case management for health and social services
resources.eligibility_requirements: South Los Angeles residents. Youth programs for ages 16-24, childcare for ages 2-5, adult services 18+.
resources.fees: Varies by program - contact for details
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'All Peoples Community Center Los Angeles address phone services'

resources.name: Kedren Community Health Center
resources.description: Comprehensive health center serving South Los Angeles for over 60 years. Provides primary care, mental health services, psychiatric services including acute psychiatric hospital, and 24/7 crisis support. Licensed and certified by LA County with multiple locations in South LA.
resources.eligibility_requirements: South Los Angeles residents. All outpatient services routed through referral from main campus. 24/7 ACCESS Center: 1-800-854-7771.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Kedren Community Health Center Los Angeles address phone mental health'

resources.name: PATH (People Assisting The Homeless)
resources.description: Pioneering homeless services organization founded 1984, serving over 26,000 people annually. Provides comprehensive continuum including homelessness prevention, street outreach, employment services, case management, interim housing, and permanent supportive housing. Operates PATH Ventures with 850 units built and 500 more in pipeline. Runs LeaseUp platform matching vulnerable populations with private rental housing countywide.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness in LA County. Veterans services available. Contact: (323) 644-2216 for intake, (213) 399-0214 for veterans.
resources.fees: Free services, affordable rent in housing programs
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'PATH Partners Advancing Toward Housing Los Angeles homeless services'

resources.name: Flintridge Center - Apprenticeship Preparation Program
resources.description: Breaking cycles of poverty and violence through comprehensive reentry support. Operates acclaimed Apprenticeship Preparation Program (APP) - a 240-hour, 10-week pre-apprenticeship program preparing formerly incarcerated individuals for union construction careers. Program achieves 10% recidivism rate vs. LA County's 40%, with 70% employment within one year.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Formerly incarcerated individuals seeking construction careers. 10-week program commitment required. Serves Pasadena and San Gabriel Valley.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Flintridge Center Pasadena employment housing services'

resources.name: Skid Row Housing Trust
resources.description: Leading permanent supportive housing provider using evidence-based Housing First model. Operates 26 buildings (24 in Downtown LA) with nearly 2,000 units for individuals experiencing homelessness, extreme poverty, disabilities, mental illness, and/or addiction. Provides affordable housing combined with critical supportive services for safe, stable living in wellness. 3 more buildings under construction.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals who have experienced homelessness, prolonged extreme poverty, poor health, disabilities, mental illness, and/or addiction. Applications processed through main office.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Skid Row Housing Trust Los Angeles address phone supportive housing'

notes: Ninth research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Geographic diversity: San Fernando Valley (Tarzana, North Hollywood), Westside (Santa Monica), South LA (4), Koreatown (2), East LA (1), Downtown LA (2), Pasadena (1), Downey (1). Service focus: substance abuse (2), mental health (2), housing (5), legal aid (2), employment (3), healthcare (2), general support (5). Includes major providers: PATH (26k served annually), Skid Row Housing Trust (2k units), Tarzana Treatment Centers, Public Counsel (largest US pro bono), Flintridge Center (10% recidivism). All contact information verified from organization websites and government sources.
